page.title: 07SPORT IN THE BEECHES
page.content: BURNHAM BEECHES GOLF CLUB is not actually in the Beeches, it is very near to it. Kiln Wood separates the Beeches from the club. The club was founded early in this century 70 to 80 years ago. It is very well established with 18 holes. Additional interest is varied wild life, squirrels, rabbits, foxes and Munjac deer, seen on the course. Membership fee is 500 pounds then 200 pound per year thereafter. There is a womans golf section too. There is also a 5 day membership, but the waiting list is the longest in the country. BURNHAM JOGGING CLUB meets in the Beeches weekends.JAWS/JOGGERS AND WHEELERS CLUB meets Sundays running and cycling down Dukes Drive, Egypt Lane, Hare Hatch Lane and back to Burnham village.THE RAMBLERS ASSOC. operates regularly in the Beeches.
